text: Applying for admission to Gratz College is the first step on the road to a quality education.  Applicants will be able to submit a resume and personal statement during the online application process.  A nonrefundable application fee of $50 is required to submit the online application.  Please contact the Office of Admissions with any questions.
Welcome to Gratz College Office of Admissions
For best admission and scholarship consideration, please have all required documents submitted by the following Priority Deadlines:
from all previous colleges attended sent directly from institution
Students must hold a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution.

) and sent to the Office of Admissions at Gratz College. Additional fees apply.

(approx. 2 pages including relevant background and experiences, why you are pursuing this degree, and how you hope to use it in the future)
For EdD only: Address one of the following two prompts for your personal statement:
Option I: Discuss a significant issue, opportunity, or research area in education. Why is this important?
Option II: Identify an important event in your educational leadership experience. Reflect on what you’ve learned from this event and how it has shaped you as an educator and/or a leader.
if you are in need of financial assistance
For scholarship consideration, you must also submit your FAFSA.
for applicants whose first language is not English or those who have not completed an undergraduate or graduate degree in the United States
Those who have completed a full foreign undergraduate or graduate degree in English may request an exemption from this requirement.
ᐩOnly one letter of recommendation is required for certificate program applications.
GREs are not required for any Gratz College program
All documents may be sent as they are ready to:

The only graduate degree program of its kind in the world
Educating within and beyond the Jewish community.
Affordable and Flexible Online Degree Programs for Working Professionals

Gratz College serves a continuum of learners with an array of online graduate, undergraduate, certificate, continuing education for professionals, such as CLE courses for lawyers, and teen programs.  Our students hail from across the nation and the world, representing a diverse range of backgrounds, affiliations, and professional experiences.
Our degree and certificate programs are designed to challenge, inspire, and engage:
Ph.D. in Holocaust and Genocide Studies
M.S. in Camp Administration and Leadership
M.A. in Holocaust and Genocide Studies
We invite you to learn more
Lunch & Learn: The Righteous Among the Nations
Lunch & Learn: Jewish Humor Goes to the Movies
